title: PCA Step-by-Step Visualizer
description: Interactive visualization demonstrating Principal Component Analysis step by step, from raw data through centering, eigenvector computation, and projection to lower dimensions.
creator: Claude AI
subject: Linear Algebra

learningObjectives: Explain the centering step and why it is necessary before PCA
Identify principal components as eigenvectors of the covariance matrix
Understand eigenvalues as variance along principal component directions
Demonstrate projection onto principal components for dimensionality reduction
Interpret scree plots to decide number of components to retain
Visualize reconstruction error from dimensionality reduction

controls.label: 1. Center
controls.description: Advance to centering step - translate data to have zero mean

controls.label: 2. Find PCs
controls.description: Compute principal components from covariance matrix eigendecomposition

controls.label: 3. Project
controls.description: Project data onto first k principal components

controls.label: k (Components)
controls.description: Number of principal components to keep (1 or 2)

controls.label: Show Reconstruction
controls.description: Display reconstruction error lines between original and projected points

controls.label: New Data
controls.description: Generate new random data with randomized parameters

controls.label: Spread
controls.description: Overall spread/scale of the data cluster

controls.label: Rotation
controls.description: Rotation angle of the elongated cluster

controls.label: Elongation
controls.description: How elongated the cluster is (ratio of major to minor axis)

visualElements: Four-panel data visualization showing each PCA step
Mean point marker in original data panel
Principal component vectors with length proportional to eigenvalue
Color-coded points for tracking through transformations
learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of pca step-by-step visualizer
Explore pca step-by-step visualizer through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of pca step-by-step visualizer to solve problems
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on pca step-by-step visualizer
